Epidermoid cyst : These cysts are filled with keratin , a protein that restricts the diffusion of water molecules . Therefore, they appear hyperintense on DWI and hypointense on ADC maps, indicating restricted diffusion. Acute infarct : Shortly after a stroke , the affected brain tissue shows cytotoxic edema where cells swell , restricting water molecule movement . Hence, an acute infarct will appear hyperintense on DWI and hypointense on ADC maps. Brain abscess : The pus within an abscess restricts water movement due to the high cellular content and debris . Thus, abscesses show restricted diffusion, appearing hyperintense on DWI and hypointense on ADC maps.
